meanings.definition: To cry out in a loud voice
meanings.sent1: The child calls for help when he is scared.
meanings.sent2: She calls out to her friend across the playground.
meanings.sent3: The cat calls loudly for its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The whistle calls out over the stadium, signaling the end of the game.
meanings.sent5: The teacher calls for attention before starting the lesson.

meanings.sent1: He calls his grandma every Sunday to chat.
meanings.sent2: I will call you later to discuss the project.
meanings.sent3: The phone calls at odd hours always startle her.
meanings.sent4: The urgent call from the boss made him rush back to the office.
meanings.sent5: She calls the customer service hotline for assistance with her order.

meanings.sent1: The coach calls the players to gather for practice.
meanings.sent2: She calls her dog by name, and it comes running.
meanings.sent3: The hiker calls for help when he gets lost in the woods.
meanings.sent4: The captain calls the crew to attention before setting sail.
meanings.sent5: The teacher calls the students back to their seats after recess.

meanings.definition: To give a name or title to
meanings.sent1: She calls her car 'Blue Lightning' because of its color.
meanings.sent2: He calls his favorite stuffed animal 'Mr. Cuddles'.
meanings.sent3: The child calls the new puppy 'Buddy' as soon as they meet.
meanings.sent4: The artist calls her masterpiece 'Sunset Serenade'.
meanings.sent5: He calls his secret hideout 'Fort Adventure'.

meanings.sent1: The calls of the seagulls fill the air at the beach.
meanings.sent2: His call for help echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent3: The loud calls of the protesters could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent4: The animal's distress call alerted the park rangers.
meanings.sent5: The haunting call of the owl pierced the silence of the night.
